49.1.hd_quote: The understanding and application of this law to maximize expansion of support.
keywords: knows when revolution is actually needed
principle must be perceived as necessary
49.1.behavioral_axis: Won’t burn the village unless the village agrees it must burn.
49.1.shadow_axis: Forces ‘necessity’ → looks like chaos or fanaticism.

49.2.hd_quote: The determination to exhaust every possible peaceful avenue for change.
49.2.behavioral_axis: Will try negotiation/arrangement before pulling the trigger.
49.2.shadow_axis: If impatient → ‘coup d’etat that has little general support.’

49.3.hd_quote: The ability to destroy antiquated forms once the restrictions have been removed.
49.3.behavioral_axis: When the door opens, it removes what no longer serves.
49.3.shadow_axis: Can be ‘savage in eliminating the old order’ and scar the new.

49.4.hd_quote: A concentration on the organization of power to clearly define authority.
49.4.behavioral_axis: Gets the tribal power structure in order so change can land.
49.4.shadow_axis: Organizes for power and forgets what the revolution was for.

49.5.hd_quote: Practical provisions for the needs of others in revolutionary times.
49.5.behavioral_axis: Makes sure the people are actually fed/supported while principles are enforced.
49.5.shadow_axis: Gets so busy guaranteeing support that the principle itself dilutes.

49.6.hd_quote: An innate impressionality that transforms the fence-sitter into the committed.
49.6.behavioral_axis: Their field itself converts people to the new principle.
49.6.shadow_axis: If over-sensitive, flips to ‘stubborn, and often fatal, rejectionism.’
